snippet: Dwyane Wade’s miss, which would have ended the Knicks’ season, was the final play in a string of seven dramatic possessions.
lead_paragraph: Dwyane Wade gave the Miami Heat the lead four times in the fourth quarter Sunday and, with the Heat down by 2 points with precious seconds ticking off the clock, he could have made it five, the fate of the Knicks' season hinging on his final shot. Wade lost the ball momentarily but regained control and dribbled into the corner. He faded away. He fired away. He said he thought the shot was good. It was not.

headline.main: After Suspenseful Plays, Game Ends With a Clang
